alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Castro; Cochran; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock; Lynn; Parmer; Terry; Yoakum (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 2:56AM CDT until April 11 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE EXTREME SOUTHWESTERN PANHANDLE AND MUCH OF THE SOUTH PLAINS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 3 PM this afternoon to 9 PM CDT this evening. A Red Flag Warning has also been issued from 11 AM to 10 PM CDT Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watches are no longer in effect. * Wind...Southwest at 15 to 20 mph at the 20 foot level today and southwest at 25 to 35 mph at the 20 foot level with gusts to 60 mph Tuesday. * Humidity...Dropping to 8 to 15 percent this afternoon, then as lows as 6 percent Tuesday. * Fuels...Extremely dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged. Conditions could be particularly dangerous on Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent or already occurring. These conditions can create rapid wildfire growth.

area.areaDesc: Bailey; Castro; Cochran; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock; Lynn; Parmer; Terry; Yoakum
